string-array.name: question
string-array.item: What is the capital of Italy?\n a) Berlin b) Paris \n c) Madrid d) Rome
Who wrote "The Great Gatsby"?\n a) Ernest Hemingway b)F. Scott Fitzgerald \n c) Jane Austen d) George Orwell
Which planet is known as the "Morning Star"?\n a) Venus b) Mars \n c) Jupiter d) Mercury
In which year did the first manned moon landing occur?\n a) 1982 b) 1975 \n c) 1969 d) 1961
Who painted "Starry Night"?\n a) Vincent van Gogh b) Pablo Picasso \n c) Claude Monet d) Leonardo da Vinci
What is the currency of South Korea?\n a) Yen b) Won \n c) Ringgit d) Baht
Which river is the longest in the world?\n a) Nile b) Amazon \n c) Yangtze d) Mississippi
Who wrote "The Catcher in the Rye"?\n a) Mark Twain b) Harper Lee \n c) J.K. Rowling d) J.D. Salinger
What is the smallest prime number?\n a) 3 b) 1 \n c) 2 d) 5
Which gas makes up the majority of Earths atmosphere?\n a) Nitrogen b) Oxygen \n c) Carbon dioxide d) Argon
Who discovered penicillin?\n a) Alexander Fleming b) Marie Curie \n c) Louis Pasteur d) Isaac Newton
What is the largest continent by land area?\n a) Europe b) Asia \n c) North America d) Africa
Who is the author of "The Hobbit"?\n a) J.K. Rowling b) C.S. Lewis \n c) J.R.R. Tolkien d) George R.R. Martin
What is the capital of Russia?\n a) Moscow b) St. Petersburg \n c) Kiev d) Warsaw
In which year did the Titanic sink?\n a) 1898 b) 1905 \n c) 1923 d) 1912
Which is the largest animal on Earth?\n a) Blue whale b) Elephant \n c) Giraffe d) Rhinoceros
What is the chemical symbol for gold?\n a) Fe b) Ag \n c) Au d) Cu
Who composed the "Moonlight Sonata"?\n a) Franz Schubert b) Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart \n c) Johann Sebastian Bach d) Ludwig van Beethoven
What is the capital of Canada?\n a) Ottawa b) Toronto \n c) Vancouver d) Montreal
Who is known as the "Father of Computers"?\n a) Steve Jobs b) Alan Turing \n c) Bill Gates d) Charles Babbage
What is the largest desert in the world?\n a) Antarctica b) Sahara \n c) Gobi d) Kalahari
Which is the largest moon of Jupiter?\n a) Ganymede b) Europa \n c) Callisto d) Io
Who wrote "The Canterbury Tales"?\n a) John Milton b) William Shakespeare \n c) Geoffrey Chaucer d) Dante Alighieri
What is the speed of light?\n a) 299,792 kilometers per second b) 314,159 kilometers per second \n c) 501,201 kilometers per second d) 200,000 kilometers per second
In which year did the Berlin Wall fall?\n a) 1963 b) 1975 \n c) 1995 d) 1989
Who is the author of "One Hundred Years of Solitude"?\n a) Gabriel Garcia Marquez b) Isabel Allende \n c) Mario Vargas Llosa d) Pablo Neruda
What is the largest species of big cat?\n a) African Lion b) Siberian Tiger \n c) Bengal Tiger d) Jaguar
Who discovered gravity?\n a) Johannes Kepler b) Albert Einstein \n c) Galileo Galilei d) Isaac Newton
What is the chemical symbol for water?\n a) NaCl b) NO2 \n c) H2O d) CO2
Which is the highest mountain in the world?\n a) Mount Everest b) K2 \n c) Kangchenjunga d) Lhotse
Who painted "The Last Supper"?\n a) Leonardo da Vinci b) Michelangelo \n c) Raphael d) Donatello
What is the capital of China?\n a) Beijing b) Shanghai \n c) Hong Kong d) Taipei
In which year did World War I begin?\n a) 1914 b) 1917 \n c) 1919 d) 1911
Who is the author of "The Odyssey"?\n a) Homer b) Virgil \n c) Sophocles d) Aesop
What is the largest bird in the world?\n a) Ostrich b) Eagle \n c) Albatross d) Penguin
Which element has the chemical symbol Na?\n a) Sodium b) Nickel \n c) Neon d) Nitrogen
Who played the character of Jack Dawson in the movie Titanic?\n a) Leonardo DiCaprio b) Tom Hanks \n c) Brad Pitt d) Johnny Depp
What is the capital of South Africa?\n a) Pretoria b) Cape Town \n c) Johannesburg d) Durban
Who wrote "The Scarlet Letter"?\n a) Nathaniel Hawthorne b) Edgar Allan Poe \n c) Herman Melville d) Emily Dickinson
Which planet is known as the "Red Planet"?\n a) Mars b) Venus \n c) Jupiter d) Saturn
Who is the lead vocalist of the band Queen?\n a) Freddie Mercury b) Mick Jagger \n c) David Bowie d) Elton John
What is the smallest prime number?\n a) 2 b) 1 \n c) 3 d) 5
Who wrote "The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes"?\n a) Arthur Conan Doyle b) Agatha Christie \n c) Raymond Chandler d) Dashiell Hammett
What is the capital of Argentina?\n a) Buenos Aires b) Rio de Janeiro \n c) Santiago d) Lima
Which planet is known as the "Blue Planet"?\n a) Earth b) Neptune \n c) Uranus d) Pluto
In which year did World War II begin?\n a) 1939 b) 1941 \n c) 1943 d) 1945
Who is the author of "The Lord of the Rings"?\n a) J.R.R. Tolkien b) C.S. Lewis \n c) J.K. Rowling d) George R.R. Martin
What is the largest animal on land?\n a) Elephant b) Giraffe \n c) Rhinoceros d) Hippopotamus
What is the chemical symbol for iron?\n a) Fe b) Au \n c) Ag d) Cu
Who is known as the "Queen of Pop"?\n a) Madonna b) Beyonc√© \n c) Rihanna d) Lady Gaga
